marklogic.body:
This, basically! It's vitally important that somebody who's not Angel NOT excuse his crimes, because when he's just surrounded by people who do it undermines them. Mind you, I think there's a world of difference between Buffy, who flat out refused to entertain the idea that Angelus was a part of Angel, and Doyle/Cordy, who are fully aware of that truth and forgive him for it.
Anyway, I love what this show does with Kate in this episode, because it's making a very mature statement on both sides of that conversation. The things you did wrong can be held against you, and all you can do is acknowledge that you deserve it, and that you can't force forgiveness. It's one of the things that fascinates me about Angel; this weird conflict between the Cold knowledge that he'll never be free of Angelus, and the very clear desire to finally attain "redemption", whatever that means.
Anyway, I'm Glad you're coming around! Psychoanalyzing Angel is one of my hobbies, lol.
